Object Title: Photograph of letter carrier delivering mail by bicycle
Creator: National Postal Museum, Curatorial Photographic Collection Photographer: Unknown
Citation for Object (MLA): “Photograph of Letter Carrier Delivering Mail by Bicycle.” Si.edu, 2025, postalmuseum.si.edu/object/npm_A.2006-33. Accessed 13 Nov. 2025.
Original Description:
An unidentified city letter carrier paused along his daily rounds. Some carriers chose bicycles to help speed their travel time.
Photographer: Unknown

Object Title: Samuel Murray and Benjamin Eakins on Bicycles
Creator: Thomas Eakins, American, b. Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 1844–1916
Repository (Source) Name: Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, DC, Gift of Joseph H. Hirshhorn, 1966
Citation for Object (MLA): “Artwork - Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden | Smithsonian.” Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden | Smithsonian, 21 Mar. 2020, hirshhorn.si.edu/collection/artwork/?edanUrl=edanmdm:hmsg_83.93. Accessed 13 Nov. 2025.
“Man with Bicycle.” National Museum of American History, 2025, n2t.net/ark:/65665/ng49ca746b3-f6ad-704b-e053-15f76fa0b4fa. Accessed 13 Nov. 2025.

Creator: Harper & Bros., New York, New York, USA
Repository (Source) Name:
Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum Collection
Drawings, Prints, and Graphic Design Department
Citation for Object (MLA): Wheeling, Print. “Print, Wheeling on Riverside Drive, 1886.” Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum, 2015, collection.cooperhewitt.org/view/objects/asitem/id/109024. Accessed 13 Nov. 2025.
Original Description: A man and woman seated side by side ride a wide bicycle vehicle with two large wheels at either side and a small wheel at the front. The couple appears to be in conversation while riding along the Hudson River, which is visible at left. At right, behind the couple, a man rides a tall pennyfarthing bicycle. Further in the background, another couple rides a bicycle in yet a different style. In the background, at right, a coachman visible behind two horses.

Creator: Rudge, Daniel 1887
Citation for Object (MLA): “Ordinary Racing Bicycle, 1887 | Smithsonian Institution.” Si.edu, 2025, www.si.edu/object/ordinary-racing-bicycle-1887:nmah_843314. Accessed 13 Nov. 2025.
Original Description: Dan Rudge & Co., of Coventry, England manufactured this Ordinary racing bicycle around 1887. This racing model was undoubtedly sold by their U.S. agents, Stoddard, Lovering & Co., of Boston, Massachusetts. The bicycle was originally owned by Godfrey A. S. Wieners who used it in racing events held by the Manhattan Athletic Club.
